text: I remember when 9/11 happened I was in
London and my first reaction was well
there goes Afghanistan as we know it the
next day I was in Islamabad and for the
next nine or 10 years
Pakistan and Afghanistan have pretty
much dominated my professional life and
now my reaction this time to the news
that Osama bin Laden died was once again
there goes Afghanistan as we know it the
United States did not invade Afghanistan
to to carry out nation-building or to
prop up the not very democratic regime
of Hamid Karzai or even to save Afghan
women from their men we invaded it in
order to get rid of a regime that was
giving aid and assistance to al-qaeda
now that the United States has killed
Osama bin Laden it takes a lot of wind
out of the sails of people who who say
we should stay in Afghanistan in
addition to the fact that they've cut
the head off the snake the snake itself
has been pretty dormant for a long time
now it's been four or five years since
al-qaeda operationally has been able to
carry out any terrorist attacks
so if al Qaeda is finished and it and
its leader is finished where does that
leave the United States in Afghanistan a
solo beacon I call on the Taliban to
learn from this killing and I bought
about of Pakistan yesterday the Taliban
should refrain from fighting they should
refrain from killing their brothers and
killing Afghanistan's Sons and
destroying Afghanistan it was very
significant that it took President Hamid
Karzai three or four hours to decide
what he was going to say or even indeed
if he was going to say anything about
this and when he did finally make a
public appearance it was by videotape so
that nobody could ask him any questions
it puts him in a very awkward position
as he well knows the raison d'Ãªtre for
the American and NATO presence in his
country has just taken a really severe
body blow and it will be really
interesting to see just how this plays
out in future weeks or months
